newsitem.title: USA: White House aide to meet with tobacco negotiators.
newsitem.headline: White House aide to meet with tobacco negotiators.

text.p: Presidential aide Bruce Lindsey was to meet Wednesday with parties in the ongoing talks on a tobacco settlement, the White House said.

White House spokesman Mike McCurry said Lindsey had scheduled "several, multiple tobacco-related meetings" that would focus on last week's U.S. district court ruling that the government can regulate tobacco sales and marketing, but not promotion and advertising.
President Clinton has said he will appeal the limits on government regulatory powers imposed by the court.
"All sides will be coming in, probably not in the same meeting," McCurry told reporters.
He said all the parties in the tobacco talks "know the critical role the White House would play if they move forward on a settlement."
